h1: Calories in a Pound of Ground Beef

disclaimer: Nutrition varies by fat content, cooking method, brand, and portion accuracy. Check labels or use a food scale for precision.

quick_answer.text: One pound of cooked 80/20 ground beef provides ~1116 kcal and ~109 g protein.

faqs.q: How many calories in a pound of 80/20 ground beef?
faqs.a: Approximately 1116 kcal for one pound cooked and drained.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a pound of ground beef?
faqs.a: About 109 g protein, making it a high-protein option.

faqs.q: Does fat percentage affect calories in ground beef?
faqs.a: Yes—leaner (90/10) has ~174 kcal/100 g vs. 246 for 80/20.

faqs.q: Are these calories for cooked or raw ground beef?
faqs.a: Cooked (pan-broiled); raw is higher due to retained moisture and fat.

faqs.q: How does cooking method change ground beef calories?
faqs.a: Broiling or baking drains more fat, lowering calories than frying with oil.
